intro: Racosperma brassii, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring small, compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils across the arid and semi-arid regions of Western Australia. Racosperma brassii is well adapted to dry conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
